00031 // Nombre maximal de dimensions d'un tableau.
00032 // Meme macro dans IntTab et DoubleTab, test si c'est deja defini

00047 //! Tableau a n entrees pour n<= 4<br>Repose sur un IntVect avec calculs de l'indice corespondant<br>Voir les commentaires de IntVect
00048 //
00049 class IntTab : public IntVect
00050 {
00051   Declare_instanciable_sans_constructeur(IntTab);
00052 public:

00056 // Pour les IntTab on ne peut pas: sinon confusion entre dimension et valeur de remplissage

00103 // Attention: pour des vecteurs distribues, la liste des cases calculees depend

00117 private:
00118 // Nombre de dimensions du tableau (nb_dim_>=1)
00119   int nb_dim_;
00120 // Dimensions "reelles" (dimensions_[0] * line_size() = size_reelle())
00121 // line_size() est egal au produit des dimensions_[i] pour 1 <= i < nb_dim_
00122   int dimensions_[MAXDIM_TAB];
00123 // Dimension totale (nombre de lignes du tableau)
00124 // = nb lignes reeles + nb lignes virtuelles
00125 // Les dimensions dimension_tot(i>=1) sont implicitement
00126 // egales a dimension(i)
00127   int dimension_tot_0_;
00128 };

00144 // int IntTab_test();
00145 inline int& IntTab::operator[](int i)
00146 {
00147   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00148   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00149   return IntVect::operator[](i);
00150 }
00151 
00152 inline const int& IntTab::operator[](int i) const
00153 {
00154   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00155   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00156   return IntVect::operator[](i);
00157 }

00160 {
00161   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00162   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00163   return IntVect::operator[](i);
00164 }
00165 
00166 inline const int& IntTab::operator()(int i) const
00167 {
00168   assert(nb_dim_ == 1 || (nb_dim_ == 2 && dimensions_[1] == 1));
00169   assert(i >= 0 && i < dimension_tot_0_);
00170   return IntVect::operator[](i);
00171 }
00172 
00173 inline int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2)
00174 {
00175   assert(nb_dim_ == 2);
00176   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00177   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00178   return IntVect::operator[](i1*dimensions_[1]+i2);
00179 }
00180 
00181 inline const int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2) const
00182 {
00183   assert(nb_dim_ == 2);
00184   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00185   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00186   return IntVect::operator[](i1*dimensions_[1]+i2);
00187 }
00188 
00189 inline int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3)
00190 {
00191   assert(nb_dim_ == 3);
00192   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00193   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00194   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00195   return IntVect::operator[]((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3);
00196 }
00197 
00198 inline const int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3) const
00199 {
00200   assert(nb_dim_ == 3);
00201   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00202   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00203   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00204   return IntVect::operator[]((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3);
00205 }
00206 
00207 inline int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4)
00208 {
00209   assert(nb_dim_ == 4);
00210   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00211   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00212   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00213   assert(i4 >= 0 && i4 < dimensions_[3]);
00214   return IntVect::operator[](((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3)*dimensions_[3]+i4);
00215 }
00216 inline const int& IntTab::operator()(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4) const
00217 {
00218   assert(nb_dim_ == 4);
00219   assert(i1 >= 0 && i1 < dimension_tot_0_);
00220   assert(i2 >= 0 && i2 < dimensions_[1]);
00221   assert(i3 >= 0 && i3 < dimensions_[2]);
00222   assert(i4 >= 0 && i4 < dimensions_[3]);
00223   return IntVect::operator[](((i1*dimensions_[1]+i2)*dimensions_[2]+i3)*dimensions_[3]+i4);
00224 }

00226 //
00227 //
00228 //
00229 //
00230 //
00231 //
00232 //! Returns one of the "real" dimensions of the multi-dimensionnal array,<br>as defined by:<br>dimension(0) = size_reelle() / line_size(), or 0 if line_size()==0<br>and, for i >= 1:<br>dimension(i) is equal to dimension_tot(i)<br>If size_reelle_ok() returns 0, it is invalid to ask for dimension(0). You can only ask for<br>dimension_tot(0) (see IntVect::size_reelle_ok())
00233 inline int IntTab::dimension(int i) const
00234 {
00235   assert(i >= 0 && i < nb_dim_);
00236 // Si dimension_[0] == -1, c'est que c'est un vecteur distribue et que l'attribut size() est invalide.
00237 // Il faut alors utiliser dimension_tot pour ce tableau.
00238   assert(dimensions_[i] >= 0);
00239   return dimensions_[i];
00240 }
00241 
00242 //
00243 //! Returns the total dimensions of the multi-dimensionnal array, including<br>virtual items (used in parallel distributed arrays)
00244 inline int IntTab::dimension_tot(int i) const
00245 {
00246   assert(i >= 0 && i < nb_dim_);
00247   if (i == 0)
00248     return dimension_tot_0_;
00249   else
00250     return dimensions_[i];
00251 }
00252 
00253 //! Returns the number of dimensions of the array (>= 1)
00254 inline int IntTab::nb_dim() const
00255 {
00256   return nb_dim_;
00257 }
00258 
00259 // Precondition: line_size() must be equal to 1 and the array must be resizable.
00260 //! Adds 1 to dimension_tot(0) and puts a in the added line.
00261 inline void IntTab::append_line(int a)
00262 {
00263   assert(line_size() == 1);
00264   assert(dimension_tot_0_ * line_size() == size_array());
00265   const int n = dimension_tot_0_;
00266   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00267   IntVect::resize_vect_(n+1, COPY_NOINIT);
00268   int * ptr = addr() + n;
00269   ptr[0] = a;
00270 }
00271 
00272 // Precondition: line_size() must be equal to 2 and the array must be resizable.
00273 //! Adds 1 to dimension_tot(0) and puts a and b in the added line.
00274 inline void IntTab::append_line(int a, int b)
00275 {
00276   assert(line_size() == 2);
00277   assert(dimension_tot_0_ * line_size() == size_array());
00278   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 2;
00279   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00280   IntVect::resize_vect_(n+2, COPY_NOINIT);
00281   int * ptr = addr() + n;
00282   ptr[0] = a;
00283   ptr[1] = b;
00284 }
00285 
00286 //! Like append_line(i,j), but for arrays with line_size()==3
00287 inline void IntTab::append_line(int a, int b, int c)
00288 {
00289   assert(line_size() == 3);
00290   assert(dimension_tot_0_  * line_size() == size_array());
00291   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 3;
00292   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00293   IntVect::resize_vect_(n+3, COPY_NOINIT);
00294   int * ptr = addr() + n;
00295   ptr[0] = a;
00296   ptr[1] = b;
00297   ptr[2] = c;
00298 }
00299 
00300 //! Like append_line(i,j), but for arrays with line_size()==4
00301 inline void IntTab::append_line(int a, int b, int c, int d)
00302 {
00303   assert(line_size() == 4);
00304   assert(dimension_tot_0_  * line_size() == size_array());
00305   const int n = dimension_tot_0_ * 4;
00306   dimensions_[0] = ++dimension_tot_0_;
00307   IntVect::resize_vect_(n+4, COPY_NOINIT);
00308   int * ptr = addr() + n;
00309   ptr[0] = a;
00310   ptr[1] = b;
00311   ptr[2] = c;
00312   ptr[3] = d;
00313 }
